#include <list.h>

 Number of memory extensions done (multiplied with LIST_ARRAY_STEPS).
void ** ppList
 Pointer to pointer array for custom objects.

Detailed Description

Definition of a list.

A list is used to store a set of pointers to user defined objects. The size of the list is adapted automatically at runtime. The size of new memory allocated when the list has reached its current limit, can be modified by redefining LIST_ARRAY_STEPS. Use the LIST_create function for creation of a new list.
